headline: Should ServiceNow’s US$7.75 Billion Armis Deal And AI Security Push Require Action From NOW Investors?
summary: In 2025, ServiceNow accelerated its AI- and security-led expansion by acquiring firms including Logik.io, data.world, Moveworks, Veza, and agreeing to buy Armis in a roughly US$7.75 billion cash deal to deepen security workflows. This push has turned Security and Risk into ServiceNow’s fifth business with more than US$1.00 billion in annual contract value, highlighting how AI-enabled security is becoming a core pillar of its workflow platform.
